title: A user can request a report to be retested even though the program has not been verified by HackerOne

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hey Team

 

I have some observations and issues which i found in my recent testing on h1 platform ( related to creation of a new private program ), So  here are my observations listed below - kindly have a look and revert back if you feel like these are valid and worth reporting issues.


1) Can A program without fully verified status have report retest feature active - (  Unnecessary disturbing the hackers of h1  - as the feature itself says that hackers will be paid 100$ for retest but here the program itself is not verified so who will be accountable to pay this 100$  )

 

I actually made a test program with handle  " ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà " ,  resolved a report onto it and then initiated the "Report Retest" feature which sent invitation to 5 hackers ( 2 of them actually tested and replied back )

 

Now current status of my test program "‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà" is :

 

{{
 

A few items have prevented your program from being validated at this time. Please reach out to support@hackerone.com if you haven't received a message with next steps.

 

Email content :::

 

Hi 3thic4l,

Thanks very much for reaching out to HackerOne. I see you have requested to invite hackers and go live with a private program.

After review, your program (‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà) is missing some key required elements for approval. In order to start a HackerOne program, you must have:

‚Ä¢             A valid Disclosure Policy that aligns with your reward structure

‚Ä¢             A valid attack surface for researchers to hack that is defined in your program's scope

‚Ä¢             A verified email address that matches your company domain

‚Ä¢             Our security team reserves the right to disallow any company whose properties it deems incompatible with the HackerOne program.

Best,

HackerOne Team

 

 

Your program is missing some required elements for approval.

See email from support@hackerone.com for additional detail.

 

}}

 And also 3 out of 5 researchers who got invited for retest are actually paid 100$ each , so I am not sure Weather it's intended feature or some bug.

2) Email bombing ( excessive spamming - I sent 50 mails in 1 minute using wearehackerone email handle ) in add participant  : ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

Its like if a program sends an invitation to example@wearehackerone.com , then by using burp intruder multiple invitation email could be sent by altering address as example+1@wearehackerone.com  and so on.

 

3) No rate limit on group creation in a program : ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà  ( Not really a security issue but there should be some rate limit - As i was able to create 20 groups in 5 secs through burp intruder )

 

4) Report Retest feature invites 5 hackers - now i am curious to know weather country check is in place in this feature ( ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà )

 

Waiting for your reply on the above mentioned issues.

Note : ( My user handle = 3thic4l  )

 

Regards

Ahmad

## Impact

Monetary loss to h1 -  coz the person/company accountable is not yet verified.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hey Team

I have some observations and issues which i found in my recent testing on h1 platform ( related to creation of a new private program ), So here are my observations listed below - kindly have a look and revert back if you feel like these are valid and worth reporting issues.

1) Can A program without fully verified status have report retest feature active - ( Unnecessary disturbing the hackers of h1 - as the feature itself says that hackers will be paid 100$ for retest but here the program itself is not verified so who will be accountable to pay this 100$ )

I actually made a test program with handle " ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà " , resolved a report onto it and then initiated the "Report Retest" feature which sent invitation to 5 hackers ( 2 of them actually tested and replied back )

Now current status of my test program "‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà" is :

{{

A few items have prevented your program from being validated at this time. Please reach out to support@hackerone.com if you haven't received a message with next steps.

Email content :::

Hi 3thic4l,

Thanks very much for reaching out to HackerOne. I see you have requested to invite hackers and go live with a private program.

After review, your program (‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà) is missing some key required elements for approval. In order to start a HackerOne program, you must have:

‚Ä¢ A valid Disclosure Policy that aligns with your reward structure

‚Ä¢ A valid attack surface for researchers to hack that is defined in your program's scope

‚Ä¢ A verified email address that matches your company domain

‚Ä¢ Our security team reserves the right to disallow any company whose properties it deems incompatible with the HackerOne program.

Best,

HackerOne Team

Your program is missing some required elements for approval.

See email from support@hackerone.com for additional detail.

}}

And also 3 out of 5 researchers who got invited for retest are actually paid 100$ each , so I am not sure Weather it's intended feature or some bug.

2) Email bombing ( excessive spamming - I sent 50 mails in 1 minute using wearehackerone email handle ) in add participant : ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

Its like if a program sends an invitation to example@wearehackerone.com , then by using burp intruder multiple invitation email could be sent by altering address as example+1@wearehackerone.com and so on.

3) No rate limit on group creation in a program : ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà ( Not really a security issue but there should be some rate limit - As i was able to create 20 groups in 5 secs through burp intruder )

4) Report Retest feature invites 5 hackers - now i am curious to know weather country check is in place in this feature ( ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà )

Waiting for your reply on the above mentioned issues.

Note : ( My user handle = 3thic4l )

Regards

Ahmad

Impact

Monetary loss to h1 - coz the person/company accountable is not yet verified.

activities.message:
I went through the h1 docs related to retesting ( https://docs.hackerone.com/programs/retesting.html ), Now here my private program (  ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà ) has product edition = response basic . which means i do not have any "Billing overview" tab in program > settings > general.

So in that i guess this retest feature should not have been enabled on my program.

kindly correct me if i am wrong.

Regards
Ahmad
activities.markdown_message:
I went through the h1 docs related to retesting ( https://docs.hackerone.com/programs/retesting.html ), Now here my private program ( ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà ) has product edition = response basic . which means i do not have any "Billing overview" tab in program > settings > general.

So in that i guess this retest feature should not have been enabled on my program.

kindly correct me if i am wrong.

Regards
Ahmad

activities.message: Hi @3thic4l - thanks for your report, it's appreciated! We'll get this fixed. The action shouldn't be available in the sandbox for the time being. This has a minor impact on the integrity, so we've updated the severity to Low. We'll keep you posted on our progress. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @3thic4l - thanks for your report, it's appreciated! We'll get this fixed. The action shouldn't be available in the sandbox for the time being. This has a minor impact on the integrity, so we've updated the severity to Low. We'll keep you posted on our progress. Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert - Thanks for replying . 
I never said that this bug has impact on integrity but it has a monetary impact on hackerone itself as in the case of my report ( ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà ) - 3 out of 5 hackers are paid 100$ for retest and as far as i read about retest feature documents , this amount has to be billed on the private program whereas in this case hackerone has paid these hackers ( correct me if i understood it all wrong ).

I am not getting why the severity is low - coz what if a person makes a sandbox program and files 10 reports on his own and then initiate a retest on all ( in that case 50 researchers would be paid 100$ that sums up to 5k$ ) and that i believe is definitely is a big monetary loss on h1. 

Nevertheless you guys surely know best.

Happy to help

I am not getting why the severity is low - coz what if a person makes a sandbox program and files 10 reports on his own and then initiate a retest on all ( in that case 50 researchers would be paid 100$ that sums up to 5k$ ) and that i believe is definitely is a big monetary loss on h1.

Nevertheless you guys surely know best.

Happy to help

activities.message:
Hey @jobert , 
Can you please elaborate " sandbox " program , I mean what's it's definition . Coz I guess the program through which I got this retest feature enabled bug is not a sandbox program. 

According to me the bug is that the retest feature gets enabled as soon as a user starts the "setup guide" of his sandbox program. Whereas this feature must get enabled only when all steps of " setup guide" are completed.
Waiting for reply.

Regards
Ahmad
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @jobert ,
Can you please elaborate " sandbox " program , I mean what's it's definition . Coz I guess the program through which I got this retest feature enabled bug is not a sandbox program.

According to me the bug is that the retest feature gets enabled as soon as a user starts the "setup guide" of his sandbox program. Whereas this feature must get enabled only when all steps of " setup guide" are completed.
Waiting for reply.

Regards
Ahmad

activities.message:
Hi @3thic4l -

> I never said that this bug has impact on integrity but it has a monetary impact on hackerone itself

It doesn't have a monetary impact. Either way, it does have a minor impact on integrity. For our programs, we have a special sandbox. This is a mode where programs can test our features, including paying bounties. When a bounty is paid in a sandboxed program, the bounty won't be paid out. Our payments go through a separate system, which only contains programs that are approved (outside of the sandbox) by HackerOne. Even though the bounties may show up in your overview, they won't be paid out.

> 2) Email bombing ( excessive spamming - I sent 50 mails in 1 minute using wearehackerone email handle ) in add participant : ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

We rely on existing rate limits, both in our backend and async job processing. We're OK with the current rate limits, so we wouldn't accept this under our bug bounty program right now.

> 3) No rate limit on group creation in a program : ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà ( Not really a security issue but there should be some rate limit - As i was able to create 20 groups in 5 secs through burp intruder )

Same answer as the above. Not an immediate security risk for us.

> 4) Report Retest feature invites 5 hackers - now i am curious to know weather country check is in place in this feature ( ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà )

That's fair feedback, I'd assume there isn't. However, the difference between the two situations is that an H1 employee invited those people, whereas with the retest feature, it's the program itself. The documentation is pretty clear in our opinion, so we don't consider this a security vulnerability.

> I am not getting why the severity is low - coz what if a person makes a sandbox program and files 10 reports on his own and then initiate a retest on all ( in that case 50 researchers would be paid 100$ that sums up to 5k$ ) and that i believe is definitely is a big monetary loss on h1.

Because the user doesn't actually get the money. If it would, we would consider this a medium or high severity vulnerability.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @3thic4l -

I never said that this bug has impact on integrity but it has a monetary impact on hackerone itself

It doesn't have a monetary impact. Either way, it does have a minor impact on integrity. For our programs, we have a special sandbox. This is a mode where programs can test our features, including paying bounties. When a bounty is paid in a sandboxed program, the bounty won't be paid out. Our payments go through a separate system, which only contains programs that are approved (outside of the sandbox) by HackerOne. Even though the bounties may show up in your overview, they won't be paid out.

2) Email bombing ( excessive spamming - I sent 50 mails in 1 minute using wearehackerone email handle ) in add participant : ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà

We rely on existing rate limits, both in our backend and async job processing. We're OK with the current rate limits, so we wouldn't accept this under our bug bounty program right now.

3) No rate limit on group creation in a program : ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà ( Not really a security issue but there should be some rate limit - As i was able to create 20 groups in 5 secs through burp intruder )

Same answer as the above. Not an immediate security risk for us.

4) Report Retest feature invites 5 hackers - now i am curious to know weather country check is in place in this feature ( ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà )

That's fair feedback, I'd assume there isn't. However, the difference between the two situations is that an H1 employee invited those people, whereas with the retest feature, it's the program itself. The documentation is pretty clear in our opinion, so we don't consider this a security vulnerability.

I am not getting why the severity is low - coz what if a person makes a sandbox program and files 10 reports on his own and then initiate a retest on all ( in that case 50 researchers would be paid 100$ that sums up to 5k$ ) and that i believe is definitely is a big monetary loss on h1.

Because the user doesn't actually get the money. If it would, we would consider this a medium or high severity vulnerability.

activities.message:
Well @jobert , thanks for clarifying ( I thought the retest bounty is paid in real ) but if it's not then yes it's definitely not a monetary impact whereas you mentioned a "special sandbox"  , where programs test your feature but they cannot work with other researchers , right?? 
Now due to this retest feature I was able to communicate with 5 real researchers and they were awarded 100$ retest bounty ( Now as you said this bounty is not paid actually but these researchers must have been notified for this ( " You have been awarded 100$ for retest " ) and hence this could lead the researchers to contact hackerone mediation as the program itself would never pay this bounty ) , Now this would impact hackerone integrity . 
Let's say I made 10 reports and initiated retest on all so now 50 researchers will get notified of 100$ bounty after retest ( but they won't actually get it ) so ultimately they'll contact h1 for mediation , which I suppose is impact on integrity.

Now wrt to rate limits : What exactly is the ratelimit at present ?? Or should I check the threshold on my own.

4) I agree with you that the program itself initiate retest  and the documentation is sufficient enough , but sooner or later these region specific programs would ask hackerone to implement a retest feature by keeping in mind thier region restriction. 

Happy to help.
activities.markdown_message:

Now due to this retest feature I was able to communicate with 5 real researchers and they were awarded 100$ retest bounty ( Now as you said this bounty is not paid actually but these researchers must have been notified for this ( " You have been awarded 100$ for retest " ) and hence this could lead the researchers to contact hackerone mediation as the program itself would never pay this bounty ) , Now this would impact hackerone integrity .
Let's say I made 10 reports and initiated retest on all so now 50 researchers will get notified of 100$ bounty after retest ( but they won't actually get it ) so ultimately they'll contact h1 for mediation , which I suppose is impact on integrity.

Now wrt to rate limits : What exactly is the ratelimit at present ?? Or should I check the threshold on my own.

4) I agree with you that the program itself initiate retest and the documentation is sufficient enough , but sooner or later these region specific programs would ask hackerone to implement a retest feature by keeping in mind thier region restriction.

Happy to help.

activities.message: Hello team ,  It looks like everyone is busy in h1212
activities.markdown_message: Hello team , It looks like everyone is busy in h1212

activities.message: Hi @3thic4l - thanks again for your report! We've released a fix for the problem you reported. We will clean up the retests you requested in the sandbox program within the next two weeks. We look forward to receive more reports from you in the future. Happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @3thic4l - thanks again for your report! We've released a fix for the problem you reported. We will clean up the retests you requested in the sandbox program within the next two weeks. We look forward to receive more reports from you in the future. Happy hacking!

additional_data.old_title: Retest feature activation without a new program bring fully verified
additional_data.new_title: A user can request a report to be retested even though the program has not been verified by HackerOne

activities.message:
> which I suppose is impact on integrity.

That's correct, which is how we came to the severity that is set on the report.

> What exactly is the ratelimit at present ??

It depends on different factors. We believe we have sufficient rate limiting in place though. You're correct that someone may generate a decent amount of email regardless of the rate limit. However, this is something we're aware of and we're discussing this internally to see what we're going to do against this.

> Also can you please let me know the current status of these two programs I made :

Both of them are sandboxed programs.

> but I think they are yet visible, So is it intentional ?

The attachments that were supposed to be redacted are already redacted. The remaining attachments are OK to be visible.

Happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message:
which I suppose is impact on integrity.

That's correct, which is how we came to the severity that is set on the report.

What exactly is the ratelimit at present ??

It depends on different factors. We believe we have sufficient rate limiting in place though. You're correct that someone may generate a decent amount of email regardless of the rate limit. However, this is something we're aware of and we're discussing this internally to see what we're going to do against this.

Also can you please let me know the current status of these two programs I made :

Both of them are sandboxed programs.

but I think they are yet visible, So is it intentional ?

The attachments that were supposed to be redacted are already redacted. The remaining attachments are OK to be visible.

Happy hacking!
